name: jewelweed
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a North American plant of the impatiens family with yellow or orange flowers with red-brown spots: The scenery includes colourful orange jewelweed and bright-yellow cinquefoil. Jewelweed often grows near poison ivy and very effectively treats the rash.
More examplesFewer examplesA single bird in a patch of jewelweed may visit as many as two hundred flowers in fifteen minutes.Jewelweed is best known for its skin-healing properties.Jewelweed is a very wide-ranging plant that occurs from Newfoundland to Alaska and south to Florida.
